post.description:
This operation allows you to setup your customer (individual) via our API.

The endpoint requires you to provide some of the details from your onboarding process 
for us to be able to setup an account and process payment on behalf of your customer.

The endpoint's response includes an `id`, which is future reference for created customer.


### Example request:

```JSON
{
  "namePrefix": "Mr.",
  "firstName": "john",
  "lastName": "smith",
  "nationality": "GB",
  "dateOfBirth": "1980-01-01",
  "placeOfBirth": "United Kingdom",
  "identification": {
    "type": "NATIONAL_ID",
    "number": "123456789"
  },
  "address": {
    "country": "GB",
    "postalCode": "SW1A 2AA",
    "city": "London",
    "street": "High Street",
    "buildingNumber": "46"
  },
  "phoneNumber": "+447895222333",
  "email": "john.smith@thebankoflondon.com",
  "organisationId": "u5vab5K9RZFTTzNJNAs3H"
}
```

### Example response:

```JSON
{
  "id": "KNm9u_s8r02SVOf4xVtIQ",
```

get.description:

get.description:
This operation allows to retrieve a list of transactions for a virtual account along with the transaction ID
(`id`) to be able to retrieve a specific transaction later via `GET
/transactions/{transactionId}`.

It must be filtered by either The Bank of London virtual account ID (`accountId`) to
retrieve only payments for a specific virtual account or by the `headerAccountId` to 
retrieve all transactions for all virtual accounts under the header account.

It can also be filtered by the `fromDate`, `toDate` and `transactionType` fields to narrow down the result set.

### Example request:
```
GET /virtual/transactions?accountId=GB-040075-12345678&fromDate=2020-10-10&toDate=2020-10-12
```
### Example for filtering by type:
```
GET /virtual/transactions?accountId=GB-040075-12345678&fromDate=2020-10-10&toDate=2020-10-12&transactionType=INTERNAL_DEBIT_THIRD_PARTY
```
The API will respond with an array of objects that contain all the details of the resulting transactions.
### Example response:
```JSON
{
  "transactions": [
    {
      "id": "0022484107DB1EED9D85FA3B8119427D001",
      "type": "INTERNAL_DEBIT_THIRD_PARTY",
      "typeDescription": "Outbound internal transfer (third party)",
      "sender": {
        "type": "TBOL",
        "accountId": "GB-040075-12345678",
        "accountNumber": "12345678",
        "sortCode": "040075"
      },
      "recipient": {
        "type": "TBOL",
        "accountId": "GB-040075-12345678",
        "accountNumber": "12345678",
        "sortCode": "040075"
      },
      "isCredit": "false",
      "reference": "Invoice 12345",
      "notes": "My first transaction",
      "amount": {
        "currency": "GBP",
        "value": 4320.5
      },
      "postingDate": "2022-10-07",
      "releaseDateTime": "2022-10-07T08:55:33.213Z",
      "valueDate": "2022-10-07",
      "createdDateTime": "2022-10-07T08:55:33.213Z",
      "account": {
        "currency": "GBP",
        "balance": 5000
      },
      "status": {
        "identifier": "SUCCESSFUL"
      }
    },
    {...}
  ],
  "metadata": {
    "totalRecords": 2,
    "pageSize": 20,
    "page": 1
  },
}
```

post.description:
This operation initiates a payment in the context of
an application registered with The Bank of London Developer Studio. It takes a request body
that contains all the necessary information required to issue a single internal payment.

All payments must originate from a Bank of London account (`sender` field). 
The `recipient` field  must be a Bank of London account ID that is owned by the requesting account holder, otherwise the request will be rejected.
A customer can only transfer between two of their own accounts eg. Operating Account → Client Collateral Account.

## Single Internal Debit Payment

### Example request body:
```JSON
{
  "type": "INTERNAL_DEBIT",
  "sender": {
    "type": "TBOL",
    "accountId": "GB-040075-12345678"
  },
  "recipient": {
    "type": "TBOL",
    "accountId": "GB-040075-87654321"
  },
  "amount": {
    "currency": "GBP",
    "value": 4320.5
  },
  "reference": "INV-12345",
  "notes": "my custom note",
  "idempotencyId": "32ed5f75-638e-454c-a91b-ec16dc8f6e84"
}
```

The API will return the ID of the created payment along with its
status after initiation. The ID can be used to retrieve the payment
details (`GET /payments/{paymentId}`) including its current status in the
future.

### Example response:
```JSON
{
  "id": "FItJ8s2G-aOUfXUFqzRXE",
  "type": "INTERNAL_DEBIT",
  "scheme": "INTERNAL",
  "sender": {
    "type": "TBOL",
    "accountId": "GB-040075-12345678"
    "sortCode": "040075",
    "accountNumber": "12345678"
  },
  "recipient": {
    "type": "TBOL",
    "accountId": "GB-040075-87654321"
    "accountHolderName": "John Smith",
    "sortCode": "040075",
    "accountNumber": "87654321"
  },
  "amount": {
    "currency": "GBP",
    "value": 4320.5
  },
  "reference": "INV-12345",
  "notes": "my custom note",
  "plannedExecutionDateTime": "2022-10-05T00:00:00.000Z",
  "status": {
    "identifier":"PENDING",
    "detailedStatusIdentifier":"RECEIVED",
    "history": [
      {
        "identifier":"PENDING",
        "detailedStatusIdentifier":"RECEIVED",
        "dateTime":"2024-05-02T15:51:15.792Z"
      },
      {
        "identifier":"PENDING",
        "detailedStatusIdentifier":"PENDING",
        "dateTime":"2024-05-02T15:51:14.939Z"
      }
    ]
  },
  "createdDateTime": "2023-10-05T12:55:54.946Z",
  "createdBy": "64e739504746e6fe27ed53b5",
  "paymentOrderId": "S4B1  20240510000000065638",
  "idempotencyId": "32ed5f75-638e-454c-a91b-ec16dc8f6e84"
}
```

## Immediate and Future Payments

Providing `plannedExecutionDateTime` for `INTERNAL_DEBIT` payment will schedule a future payment whereas omitting the
`plannedExecutionDateTime` will result in an immediate payment.


The consumer application (identified by the API key) must always have
the permission to execute payments from the sender's account.

post.description:
This operation initiates a Bacs payment in the context of
an application registered with The Bank of London Developer Studio. It takes a request body
that contains all the necessary information required to issue either a
single or a standing order Bacs payment. The `type` field serves as a discriminator.

Bacs operates on a 3 working day cycle between Monday to Friday. The scheme does not operate on weekends and Bank holidays (England & Wales).

On successful acceptance and processing of your payments, funds will be held in your account on Day 1 and will typically be credited to the recipient's account on Day 3.

You can recall a Bacs payment only up to 5.30PM on the day you initiate the payment; for any recalls, please contact the customer service team by email: `uksupport@thebankoflondon.com` or call us on `+44 3301 659 131`

All payments must originate from a Bank of London account (`sender` field)
and can be transferred to any UK domestic account of another bank.

The consumer application (identified by the API key) must always have
the permission to execute payments from the sender's account.

## Single Bacs Debit Payment

### Example request body:
```JSON
{
  "type": "BACS_DEBIT",
  "sender": {
    "type": "TBOL",
    "accountId": "GB-040075-12345678"
  },
  "payments": [
    {
      "recipient": {
        "type": "UK",
        "sortCode": "123456",
        "accountNumber": "12345678",
        "accountHolderName": "John Smith"
      },
      "amount": {
        "currency": "GBP",
        "value": 1
      },
      "reference": "INV-12345",
      "notes": "my note"
    }
  ],
  "plannedExecutionDate": "2023-10-05",
  "idempotencyId": "32ed5f75-638e-454c-a91b-ec16dc8f6e84"
}
```

The API will return the ID of the created payment along with its
status after initiation. The ID can be used to retrieve the payment
details (`GET /payments/{paymentId}`) including its current status in the
future.

### Example response:
```JSON
{
  "id": "eWD5O4sUHIuoV_KnlSG6j",
  "type": "BACS_DEBIT",
  "scheme": "BACS",
  "sender": {
    "type": "TBOL",
    "accountId": "GB-040075-12345678",
    "sortCode": "040075",
    "accountNumber": "12345678"
  },
  "payments": [
    {
      "recipient": {
        "type": "UK",
        "sortCode": "123456",
        "accountNumber": "12345678",
        "accountHolderName": "John Smith"
      },
      "amount": {
        "value": 1,
        "currency": "GBP"
      },
      "reference": "INV-12345",
      "notes": "my note"
    }
  ],
  "plannedExecutionDate": "2023-10-05",
  "status": {
    "identifier":"PENDING",
    "detailedStatusIdentifier":"RECEIVED",
    "history": [
      {
        "identifier":"PENDING",
        "detailedStatusIdentifier":"RECEIVED",
        "dateTime":"2024-05-02T15:51:15.792Z"
      },
      {
        "identifier":"PENDING",
        "detailedStatusIdentifier":"PENDING",
        "dateTime":"2024-05-02T15:51:14.939Z"
      }
    ]
  },
  "createdDateTime": "2023-10-05T12:55:54.946Z",
  "createdBy": "64e739504746e6fe27ed53b5",
  "paymentOrderId": "S4B1  20240510000000065638".
  "idempotencyId": "32ed5f75-638e-454c-a91b-ec16dc8f6e84"
}
```

## Immediate and Future Payments

Providing a future date for `plannedExecutionDate` for `BACS_DEBIT` payment will schedule a future payment. Providing today's date for `plannedExecutionDate` will result in an immediate payment.

Payments are processed in the Europe/London timezone so `plannedExecutionDate` must be a UK date in the format `YYYY-MM-DD`.

post.description:
This operation initiates a CHAPS payment in the context of
an application registered with The Bank of London Developer Studio. It takes a request body
that contains all the necessary information required to issue a
single CHAPS payment.

CHAPS operates same day processing between Monday to Friday; our current cut off for same day payment is 1.00PM,
and payments submitted after this cut-off time will be processed the next working day. The scheme does not 
operate on weekends and bank holidays (England & Wales).

Please ensure that any CHAPS payments are only made on your behalf and not on behalf of your clients 
(if applicable).

Virtual accounts cannot be used for CHAPS payments.

TBOL uses an agency bank to process CHAPS payments on its behalf; CHAPS payments cannot be reversed. If you need
any assistance, please contact us as soon as possible at uksupport@thebankoflondon.com or call us on 
+443301 659 131

## Single CHAPS Payment

### Example request body:
```JSON
{
  "type": "CHAPS_DEBIT",
  "sender": {
    "type": "TBOL",
    "accountId": "GB-040075-12345678"
  },
  "recipient": {
    "type": "UK",
    "accountHolderName": "John Smith",
    "sortCode": "123456",
```

get.description:
This operation allows to retrieve a list of transactions along with the transaction ID
(`id`) to be able to retrieve a specific transaction later via `GET
/transactions/{transactionId}`.

It must be filtered by The Bank of London account ID (`accountId`) to
retrieve only payments for a specific account. 

It can also be filtered by the `fromDate`, `toDate` and `transactionType` fields to narrow down the result
set.

### Example request:

```
GET /transactions?accountId=GB-040075-12345678&fromDate=2020-10-10&toDate=2020-10-12
```

### Example for filtering by type:
```
GET /transactions?accountId=GB-040075-12345678&fromDate=2020-10-10&toDate=2020-10-12&transactionType=INTERNAL_DEBIT_THIRD_PARTY
```

The API will respond with an array of objects that contain all the details of the resulting transactions.

post.description:
This operation allows you to configure Webhooks, enabling you to receive notifications about various events related to your payments or transactions.

The response includes the public key of the webhook. The public key is used to verify the signature of the webhook events.

For more details on our webhook solution, please read [our webhooks guide](https://developer.thebankoflondon.com/docs/guides/manage-webhooks-guide).

### Example request:

```JSON
{
  "name": "My Webhook",
  "url": "https://www.your-webhook-handling-url.com/api/payment-event-callback",
  "events": [
    "TRANSACTION_SUCCESSFUL",
    "TRANSACTION_FAILED"
  ],
  "version": 2
}
```

### Example response:

```json
{
  "id": "QF6T5cuAyRE3BnHFHWD0z",
  "name": "My Webhook",
  "url": "https://www.your-webhook-handling-url.com/api/payment-event-callback",
  "events": [
    "TRANSACTION_SUCCESSFUL",
    "TRANSACTION_FAILED"
  ],
  "version": 2,
  "enabled": true,
  "publicKey": "-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----\nMvQI...SjAgEA-----END PUBLIC KEY-----",
  "createdDate": "2020-01-01T00:00:00.000Z"
}
```

requestBody.description: The object containing data about the Webhook.

events.description: **Attention** \ Please note that the allowed values for the **events** are extensible and new values can be added in the future without a major version change. Please ensure this is factored into your application code. The type of event. \ `PAYMENT_PENDING` - payment has been created and is `PENDING` or `SCHEDULED`. \ `PAYMENT_FAILED` - payment has been updated with a status of `REJECTED` or `FAILED`. \ `TRANSACTION_SUCCESSFUL` - transaction has been created and successfully settled. \ `TRANSACTION_FAILED` - transaction has been updated with a status of `REJECTED`, `FAILED`, `RETURNED` or `CANCELLED`. \ `TRANSACTION_EXPORT_SUCCESSFUL` - transaction export has completed successfully. \ `TRANSACTION_EXPORT_FAILED` - transaction export has failed.

get.description:
Retrieves the list of webhooks that are associated with the consumer application.

For more details on our webhook solution, please read [our webhooks guide](https://developer.thebankoflondon.com/docs/guides/manage-webhooks-guide).

### Example request:

```
GET /webhooks
```

### Example response:
```JSON
{
  "webhooks": [
    {
      "id": "QF6T5cuAyRE3BnHFHWD0z",
      "name": "My Webhook",
      "url": "https://www.your-webhook-handling-url.com/api/payment-event-callback",
      "events": [
        "TRANSACTION_SUCCESSFUL",
        "TRANSACTION_FAILED"
      ],
      "version": 2,
      "enabled": true,
      "publicKey": "-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----\nMvQI...SjAgEA-----END PUBLIC KEY-----",
      "createdDate": "2020-01-01T00:00:00.000Z"
    },
    {...}
  ],
  "metadata": {
    "totalRecords": 15,
    "pageSize": 20,
    "page": 1
  },
}
```

x-correlation-id.description: A unique identifier assigned to each request, facilitating issue tracing. In the event that a problem arises with a request, this ID can be provided to The Bank of London support team for assistance.

patch.description:
This operation allows you to update an existing webhook.

For more details on our webhook solution, please read [our webhooks guide](https://developer.thebankoflondon.com/docs/guides/manage-webhooks-guide).

### Example request:

```JSON
{
  "events": [
    "TRANSACTION_SUCCESSFUL",
    "TRANSACTION_FAILED"
  ]
}
```

### Example response:

Returns the updated webhook if the provided `id` is valid. Otherwise, a response with a 404 status code is returned..


```JSON
{
  "id": "QF6T5cuAyRE3BnHFHWD0z",
  "name": "My Webhook",
  "url": "https://www.your-webhook-handling-url.com/api/payment-event-callback",
  "events": [
    "TRANSACTION_SUCCESSFUL",
    "TRANSACTION_FAILED"
  ],
  "version": 2,
  "enabled": true,
  "publicKey": "-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----\nMvQI...SjAgEA-----END PUBLIC KEY-----",
  "createdDate": "2020-01-01T00:00:00.000Z"
}
```

requestBody.description: The object containing data about the Webhook.

allOf.description:
The type of event. \
`PAYMENT_PENDING` - payment has been created and is `PENDING` or `SCHEDULED`. \
`PAYMENT_FAILED` - payment has been updated with a status of `REJECTED` or `FAILED`. \
`TRANSACTION_SUCCESSFUL` - transaction has been created and successfully settled. \
`TRANSACTION_FAILED` - transaction has been updated with a status of `REJECTED`, `FAILED`, `RETURNED` or `CANCELLED`. \
`TRANSACTION_EXPORT_SUCCESSFUL` - transaction export has completed successfully. \
`TRANSACTION_EXPORT_FAILED` - transaction export has failed.

delete.description:
This operation allows you to delete a webhook.

Returns an empty response if the provided `id` is valid. Otherwise, a response with a 404 status code is returned.

For more details on our webhook solution, please read [our webhooks guide](https://developer.thebankoflondon.com/docs/guides/manage-webhooks-guide).

### Example request:

```
DELETE /webhooks/RBf1q02PaupHGtVFcLm_S
```

x-correlation-id.description: A unique identifier assigned to each request, facilitating issue tracing. In the event that a problem arises with a request, this ID can be provided to The Bank of London support team for assistance.

post.description:
This operation allows you to create a test event for a webhook.

Returns an empty response if the provided `id` is valid. Otherwise, a response with a 404 status code is returned.

If the webhook is not enabled, a response with a 400 status code is returned.

If the request to the webhook fails, an email will be sent to all users of the consumer application with the Webhook Degradation contact preference enabled.

For more details on our webhook solution, please read [our webhooks guide](https://developer.thebankoflondon.com/docs/guides/manage-webhooks-guide).

### Example request:

```
POST /webhooks/RBf1q02PaupHGtVFcLm_S/create-test-event
```

post.description:
This operation allows you to regenerate the key for an existing webhook.

Returns a new public key if the provided webhook `id` is valid. Otherwise, a response with a 404 status code is returned.

For more details on our webhook solution, please read [our webhooks guide](https://developer.thebankoflondon.com/docs/guides/manage-webhooks-guide).

### Example request:

```
POST /webhooks/RBf1q02PaupHGtVFcLm_S/regenerate-key
```

### Example response:

```json
{
  "id": "RBf1q02PaupHGtVFcLm_S",
  "publicKey": "-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----\nMvQI...SjAgEA-----END PUBLIC KEY-----"
}
```

AccountOwnership.description:
Controls whether to return directly linked or customers' physical accounts, or both.

DIRECT - returns directly linked physical accounts (DEFAULT).

INDIRECT - returns customers' physical accounts.

ALL - combines both of the above.

AccountId.description: The Bank of London account ID identifies the account within the The Bank of London API. This field is considered a unique ID and cannot be constructed using the account number and sort code. As such it must only be provided with `accountId` values returned by The Bank of London Account API.

Account is inactive and cannot be used to process payments.

totalDebitsCurrentMonth.description: The total debits on the account in the current month.

available.description: The available balance is the amount of money that the account holder can withdraw immediately.

current.description: The current balance includes any pending transactions that have not yet been cleared.

It will be unlocked at the end of fixed term.

Supplying the `accountOwnership` will return virtual accounts for specific ownership. \
`ALL`: all virtual accounts directly and indirectly linked to the requestor \
`DIRECT`: virtual accounts directly linked to the requestor \
`INDIRECT`: virtual accounts for both individuals and organisations

Please ensure this is factored into your application code. The type of account \ `VIRTUAL_ACCOUNT`: Virtual Deposit Account. Accounts can be internally or externally addressable, both forms support direct and indirect payments. \ `VIRTUAL_SUSPENSE`: Virtual Suspense Account. Manages the balancing of the virtual hierarchy in case of an unreconciled payment. \ `VIRTUAL_PANDL`: Virtual Profit & Loss Account. Allows profit to be taken from Virtual Account hierarchy by having different interest between real and virtual hierarchies.

`BACS_DIRECT_DEBIT_REGULARDDI`: BACS Direct Debit Outbound Regular Payment per Direct Debit Instruction \

TransactionStatusQueryParam.description:
The statuses listed below can be used as query values. In order to query for \
multiple statuses, the query param can be repeated. \
e.g ...?status=SUCCESSFUL&status=AWAITING_APPROVAL \
 \
`PENDING`: The transaction is being processed \
`SUCCESSFUL`: The transaction has been processed and posted  \
`AWAITING_APPROVAL`: The transaction is awaiting approval  \
`REJECTED`: The transaction was rejected  \
`RETURNED`: The transaction was returned  \
`CANCELLED`: The transaction was cancelled

TransactionIsCredit.description: Returns the transactions that are credit (`isCredit=true`) or debit (`isCredit=false`). If not provided, both credit and debit transactions are returned.

TransactionSearch.description:
Enables transaction search by `sender.reference`, `recipient.reference`, `recipient.accountHolderName`, `typeDescription`, and `amount.value`. 

The search is case-insensitive and supports partial matches.

You can include multiple words in the search query, separated by spaces. When multiple words are provided, the search returns transactions containing all the words in the query.

If an amount is specified, the search returns both credit and debit transactions matching that amount.

Transactions are ordered by `createdDateTime` by default. You can change the order using the `orderBy` query parameter.

PaymentStatusQueryParam.description:
Payment statuses listed below can be used as query values. In order to query for \
multiple statuses, the query param can be repeated \
e.g ...?status=PENDING&status=SUCCESSFUL \
 \
`PENDING_APPROVAL`: Initial status of a payment that requires approval before processing. \
`PENDING`: Payment is currently being processed within The Bank of London system.  \
`APPROVED`: The payment has been approved by an authorised payment approver  \
`REJECTED`: The payment has been rejected by an authorised payment approver  \
`SUCCESSFUL`: Payment has been processed and passed all checks.  \
`FAILED`: One or more checks failed whilst processing the payment.

Together with the end date (`endDateTime`) or the number of payments (`numberOfPayments`) the payment schedule is determined.

StartDateTime.description: The date when the standing order payment should be executed by The Bank of London. Any weekday date can be provided to schedule a future payment with the exclusion of weekends and public holidays. The date time should be formatted to the UTC date format (ISO8601). The time element will be ignored on the date time. `2022-10-05T11:01:00.000Z` is a valid example. If no date time is provided, this will be defaulted to the current date time.

NumberOfPayments.description: The number of payments that should be made for a standing order.

EndDateTime.description: The date when the standing order payment should be executed by The Bank of London. Any future date can be provided to schedule a future payment. The date time should be formatted to the UTC date format (ISO8601). The time element will be ignored on the date time. `2022-10-05T13:01:00.000Z` is a valid example.

StandingOrderStatusQueryParam.description:
Standing order statuses listed below can be used as query values. In order to query for \
multiple statuses, the query param can be repeated \
e.g ...?status=PENDING&status=ACTIVE \
 \
`PENDING_APPROVAL`: Initial status of a standing order that requires approval before processing. \
`PENDING`: Standing order is currently being processed within The Bank of London system.  \
`APPROVED`: The standing order has been approved by an authorised payment approver  \
`REJECTED`: The standing order has been rejected by an authorised payment approver  \
`ACTIVE`: The standing order instruction is active and will make payments at the cadence defined by the schedule  \
`FAILED`: One or more checks failed whilst processing the standing order. \
`INACTIVE`: The instruction has reached end-of-life, it has either executed the number of payments configured or has reached the end date \
`CANCELLED`: Standing order has been cancelled by the sender.

Statement.description: Response object of getting a statement

WebhookName.description: The name of the webhook. - Name must be unique within an environment (`sandbox` or `live`) for an account.

Url.description: The url of webhook target. - Url must be `https`. - A combination of the `version` and `url` must be unique within an environment (`sandbox` or `live`) for an account.

WebhookEvent.description: **Attention** \ Please note that the allowed values for the **events** are extensible and new values can be added in the future without a major version change. Please ensure this is factored into your application code. The type of event. \ `PAYMENT_PENDING` - payment has been created and is `PENDING` or `SCHEDULED`. \ `PAYMENT_FAILED` - payment has been updated with a status of `REJECTED` or `FAILED`. \ `TRANSACTION_SUCCESSFUL` - transaction has been created and successfully settled. \ `TRANSACTION_FAILED` - transaction has been updated with a status of `REJECTED`, `FAILED`, `RETURNED` or `CANCELLED`. \ `TRANSACTION_EXPORT_SUCCESSFUL` - transaction export has completed successfully. \ `TRANSACTION_EXPORT_FAILED` - transaction export has failed.

WebhookVersion.description:
The version of API to subscribe to. 

A combination of the `url` and `version` must be unique within an environment (`sandbox` or `live`) for an account.

WebhookEnabledStatus.description: Indicates whether the webhook is enabled or not.

WebhookPublicKey.description: The public key of the webhook.

WebhookCreatedDate.description: The date and time the webhook was created.

events.description: **Attention** \ Please note that the allowed values for the **events** are extensible and new values can be added in the future without a major version change. Please ensure this is factored into your application code. Array of events which the webhook subscribes to. The events must be unique and cannot be empty. \ The type of event. \ `PAYMENT_PENDING` - payment has been created and is `PENDING` or `SCHEDULED`. \ `PAYMENT_FAILED` - payment has been updated with a status of `REJECTED` or `FAILED`. \ `TRANSACTION_SUCCESSFUL` - transaction has been created and successfully settled. \ `TRANSACTION_FAILED` - transaction has been updated with a status of `REJECTED`, `FAILED`, `RETURNED` or `CANCELLED`. \ `TRANSACTION_EXPORT_SUCCESSFUL` - transaction export has completed successfully. \ `TRANSACTION_EXPORT_FAILED` - transaction export has failed.

JwsSignature.description: A JSON web signature representing signed content using JSON data structures. It contains contextual information from the request signed using a private key generated within The Bank of London Developer Studio application.

StatementStartDateQueryParam.description: The oldest `endDate` from which the statements will be provided.
